rules: Rule1: Provided that the rescuer assesses damage from a building collapse, the rescuer requires extraction tools.
Rule2: Either the rescuer assesses damage from a building collapse or the rescuer identifies gas leaks as hazards.
Rule3: Whenever the rescuer identifies gas leaks as hazards, the rescuer requires structural analysis expertise.
Rule4: If the rescuer coordinates effort with the command center, then if the rescuer applies triage procedures, the rescuer achieves success by accomplishing the mission.
Rule5: Supposing that the rescuer communicates status to the incident commander, then the rescuer coordinates effort with the command center.
Rule6: In case the rescuer maintains safety in the rescue zone, then the rescuer communicates status to the incident commander.
Rule7: Either the rescuer evacuates the danger zone or the rescuer maintains safety in the rescue zone.
Rule8: If the rescuer loses communication with the radio system, then the rescuer establishes contact with the base station.
Rule9: Either the rescuer loses communication with the radio system or if the rescuer escalates the incident to a major emergency, then the rescuer requests assistance from the fire department.
Rule10: In the event that the rescuer uses a first aid kit, then if the rescuer has medical training, the rescuer achieves success by accomplishing the mission.
Rule11: The rescuer stabilizes an injured person or the rescuer transports a victim to a medical facility.
Rule12: Provided that the rescuer transports a victim to a medical facility, the rescuer achieves success by accomplishing the mission.
Rule13: Either the rescuer faces a debris pile as an obstacle or if the rescuer performs a rescue operation, then the rescuer reaches the goal of saving victims.
Rule14: If the rescuer finds an alternative access route, then it is not the case that the rescuer faces a debris pile as an obstacle.
Rule15: The rescuer finds an alternative access route or the rescuer uses breaching tools.
Rule16: Either the rescuer encounters an earthquake or the rescuer uses a first aid kit.
Rule17: Under the condition that the rescuer locates trapped people, the rescuer reaches the goal of saving victims.
Rule18: Provided that the rescuer assesses victim stability, the rescuer locates trapped people.
Rule19: If the rescuer plans victim removal, then the rescuer assesses victim stability.
Rule20: Assuming that the rescuer monitors the environment for aftershock risk, then the rescuer detects structural movement.
Rule21: Either the rescuer monitors the environment for aftershock risk or if the rescuer executes a rescue strategy, then the rescuer plans victim removal.
Rule22: Whenever the rescuer continues effort under calculated risk, then it is not the case that the rescuer suspends operation due to unsafe conditions.
Rule23: In the event that the rescuer receives a weather alert update, then the rescuer adjusts the plan based on new conditions.
Rule24: Provided that the rescuer receives a weather alert update, then the rescuer does not adjust the plan based on new conditions.
Rule25: Either the rescuer receives a weather alert update or if the rescuer evaluates the situation through risk assessment, then the rescuer continues effort under calculated risk.
Rule26: Either the rescuer activates the emergency response protocol or it is not the case that the rescuer encounters an earthquake.
Rule27: Under the condition that the rescuer wears protective equipment, the rescuer maintains safety in the rescue zone.
Rule28: The rescuer wears protective equipment or the rescuer follows safety guidelines.
Rule29: Supposing that the rescuer controls access to the rescue perimeter, then the rescuer maintains safety in the rescue zone.

Rule30: If the rescuer documents the incident in an official report, then if it is not the case that if it is not the case that if the rescuer controls access to the rescue perimeter then the rescuer permits entry to authorized personnel then the rescuer denies access to unauthorized individuals, then it is not the case that the rescuer enforces the security zone boundary.
Rule31: Either the rescuer documents the incident in an official report or the rescuer provides testimony to the investigation team.

Rule32: Whenever the rescuer provides testimony to the investigation team, then if it is not the case that if it is not the case that if the rescuer controls access to the rescue perimeter then the rescuer permits entry to authorized personnel then the rescuer denies access to unauthorized individuals, then it is not the case that the rescuer enforces the security zone boundary.
Rule33: If the rescuer performs a rescue operation, then the rescuer executes a rescue strategy.
Rule34: Under the condition that the rescuer maintains vigilance for potential hazards, the rescuer maintains safety in the rescue zone.
Rule35: Provided that the rescuer conducts an area inspection sweep, the rescuer maintains safety in the rescue zone.
Rule36: If the rescuer reports findings to the supervisor, then either the rescuer maintains vigilance for potential hazards or the rescuer conducts an area inspection sweep.
Rule37: Supposing that the rescuer updates the activity record log, then either the rescuer maintains vigilance for potential hazards or the rescuer conducts an area inspection sweep.
Rule38: Whenever the rescuer exceeds performance goals, then the rescuer completes mission objectives.
Rule39: In case the rescuer coordinates multiple units, then either backup arrives as a support team for the rescuer or it is not the case that the rescuer loses communication with the radio system.
Rule40: Provided that the rescuer delegates tasks to team members, then the rescuer coordinates multiple units.
Rule41: Either the rescuer delegates tasks to team members or the rescuer assumes a command role.
Rule42: Assuming that the rescuer assumes a command role, then the rescuer coordinates multiple units.
Rule43: If the rescuer reaches the goal of saving victims, then the rescuer achieves success by accomplishing the mission.
Rule44: Supposing that the rescuer manages available equipment resources, then the rescuer allocates essential items supplies.
Rule45: Under the condition that the rescuer allocates essential items supplies, then it is not the case that the rescuer loses communication with the radio system.
Rule46: Provided that the rescuer verifies the identity of a trapped individual, then it is not the case that the rescuer confirms victim position location.
Rule47: In case the rescuer collects personal details information, then the rescuer records victim information data.
Rule48: Supposing that the rescuer records victim information data, then the rescuer updates rescue records in the database.
Rule49: Whenever the rescuer updates rescue records in the database, then the rescuer establishes the victim's name identity.
Rule50: Provided that the rescuer sets a security boundary perimeter, then the rescuer secures the collapse site.
Rule51: Either the rescuer sets a security boundary perimeter or the rescuer posts guards at access points.

Rule52: Under the condition that the rescuer follows media protocol procedure, then if if the rescuer posts guards at access points then if it is not the case that if the rescuer stabilizes an injured person then the rescuer achieves success by accomplishing the mission then the rescuer does not administer critical care, then the rescuer authorizes entry for media representatives.
Rule53: Supposing that the rescuer grants an interview to a news outlet, then the rescuer declines comment on a press inquiry.
Rule54: Either the rescuer withholds sensitive information details or it is not the case that the rescuer releases an official communication statement.

Rule55: Provided that the rescuer requires extraction tools, then if it is not the case that if the rescuer performs a rescue operation then the rescuer reaches the goal of saving victims, then the rescuer requires an additional team as backup.

Rule56: If the rescuer requires structural analysis expertise, then if it is not the case that if the rescuer performs a rescue operation then the rescuer reaches the goal of saving victims, then the rescuer requires an additional team as backup.
Rule57: If it is not the case that if the rescuer stabilizes an injured person then the rescuer achieves success by accomplishing the mission, then the rescuer administers critical care.

Rule58: If it is not the case that either the rescuer secures the collapse site or if it is not the case that if the rescuer stabilizes an injured person then the rescuer achieves success by accomplishing the mission then the rescuer does not administer critical care, then the rescuer marks the rescue target location.

Rule59: Supposing that it is not the case that either the rescuer secures the collapse site or if it is not the case that if the rescuer stabilizes an injured person then the rescuer achieves success by accomplishing the mission then the rescuer does not administer critical care, then it is not the case that the rescuer marks the rescue target location.

Rule60: In case it is not the case that if the rescuer uses breaching tools then it is not the case that the rescuer faces a debris pile as an obstacle, then the rescuer calls a technical rescue specialist.

Rule61: Under the condition that it is not the case that if the rescuer uses breaching tools then it is not the case that the rescuer faces a debris pile as an obstacle, then it is not the case that the rescuer calls a technical rescue specialist.
Rule62: If it is not the case that if the rescuer follows safety guidelines then the rescuer maintains safety in the rescue zone, then the rescuer violates safety rules.

Rule63: Assuming that it is not the case that if the rescuer performs a rescue operation then the rescuer achieves success by accomplishing the mission, then the rescuer suspends operation due to unsafe conditions.

Rule64: Supposing that it is not the case that if the rescuer performs a rescue operation then the rescuer achieves success by accomplishing the mission, then the rescuer evaluates the situation through risk assessment.
Rule65: Provided that it is not the case that either the rescuer reports findings to the supervisor or the rescuer updates the activity record log, then the rescuer exceeds performance goals.

Rule66: If it is not the case that if the rescuer grants an interview to a news outlet then it is not the case that the rescuer declines comment on a press inquiry, then the rescuer releases an official communication statement.

Rule67: Supposing that it is not the case that if it is not the case that if the rescuer stabilizes an injured person then the rescuer achieves success by accomplishing the mission then the rescuer does not administer critical care, then the rescuer confirms victim position location.

Rule68: Provided that it is not the case that if it is not the case that if it is not the case that if the rescuer stabilizes an injured person then the rescuer achieves success by accomplishing the mission then the rescuer does not administer critical care then the rescuer verifies the identity of a trapped individual, then the rescuer collects personal details information.

Rule69: Supposing that it is not the case that if it is not the case that if it is not the case that if the rescuer stabilizes an injured person then the rescuer achieves success by accomplishing the mission then the rescuer does not administer critical care then the rescuer verifies the identity of a trapped individual, then it is not the case that the rescuer establishes the victim's name identity.

Rule70: In the event that it is not the case that if it is not the case that if the rescuer controls access to the rescue perimeter then the rescuer permits entry to authorized personnel then the rescuer denies access to unauthorized individuals, then the rescuer enforces the security zone boundary.
Rule71: Assuming that it is not the case that the rescuer controls access to the rescue perimeter, then it is not the case that the rescuer permits entry to authorized personnel.
Rule72: Supposing that it is not the case that the rescuer follows media protocol procedure, then the rescuer grants an interview to a news outlet.
Rule73: In case it is not the case that the rescuer achieves success by accomplishing the mission, then the rescuer escalates the incident to a major emergency.
facts: Fact1: The rescuer has medical training.
Fact2: The rescuer applies triage procedures.
Fact3: The rescuer performs a rescue operation.
Fact4: The rescuer manages available equipment resources.
Fact5: It is not the case that the rescuer evacuates the danger zone.
Fact6: It is not the case that the rescuer requests assistance from the fire department.
Fact7: It is not the case that the rescuer establishes contact with the base station.
Fact8: It is not the case that the rescuer secures the collapse site.
Fact9: It is not the case that the rescuer detects structural movement.
Fact10: It is not the case that the rescuer activates the emergency response protocol.
Fact11: It is not the case that the rescuer violates safety rules.
Fact12: It is not the case that the rescuer denies access to unauthorized individuals.
Fact13: It is not the case that the rescuer completes mission objectives.
Fact14: It is not the case that backup arrives as a support team for the rescuer.
Fact15: It is not the case that the rescuer requires an additional team as backup.
Fact16: It is not the case that the rescuer authorizes entry for media representatives.
Fact17: It is not the case that the rescuer withholds sensitive information details.

question: The rescuer achieves success by accomplishing the mission.
